1. Your silicon laws are your rules Silicon players are given a list of active laws. Each of these laws is effectively a roleplay rule that the character must follow. The primary differences between laws and actual rules are that the lawyering of laws is much more tolerated than the lawyering of rules, and that silicon laws are more dynamic than rules. Silicon laws can change during a round, and different characters have different laws, whereas everyone shares the same set of rules.
- Lawyering refers to finding and exploiting loopholes, which are unintended but reasonable interpretations. The rules are written in an attempt to communicate intention, but silicon laws are written with the intention that loopholes become exploitable.
